Ad Text:
Job Title: Data Engineer
Location: Melbourne, Australia
Reporting To: Head of Data Engineering
Employment Status: Permanent / Contractor

Background
We’re proud to partner with a leading global organisation that’s driving data innovation across infrastructure, utilities, energy, and telecommunications. Backed by extensive enterprise-scale operations and a shared commitment to sustainability and digital transformation, our partners are delivering projects that reshape how critical systems operate around the world.
Eighteen months ago, this organisation expanded into Melbourne, recognising the city’s importance in Australia’s energy transition. Since then, they’ve partnered with some of the most forward-thinking utility providers in the Asia Pacific, working on large-scale modernisation initiatives that use data engineering and machine learning to solve real-world infrastructure challenges. With demand growing and technical scope expanding, they’re building out their local data team to take this work even further.

Why Join
As part of this high-performing data and engineering team, you’ll work on technically ambitious use cases across utilities, energy, and infrastructure transformation. The team partners with leaders in the field to apply cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Azure-native tools to deliver production-grade data systems that enable predictive maintenance, optimisation, and smarter decision-making.
This is an opportunity to shape data-driven solutions that have measurable impact, from reducing network outages to improving the reliability of essential services. You'll be joining a group of curious, capable peers who value experimentation, solid engineering principles, and delivering meaningful outcomes at scale.

How We’re Making an Impact
In one recent engagement, the team helped a major electricity distributor predict which transformers were most at risk of overload. By combining telemetry data, geospatial context, and consumption patterns, they created a scalable model that guided maintenance decisions and reduced infrastructure costs by millions. It’s the kind of work that shows how purposeful data engineering can change how society’s most critical systems operate.

Role Overview
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines using Spark and Microsoft Fabric to support analytics, reporting, and machine learning products.
Collaborate with leading utility providers in electricity, gas, and water to solve operational challenges.
Leverage tools such as Databricks, machine learning, and generative AI (like autonomous agents) to design and deliver innovative data-driven solutions.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and operate cloud-based data pipelines that support analytical products and predictive insights.
Apply DevOps practices across CI/CD, automated testing, version control, and release automation.
Contribute to solution design, collaborating cross-functionally to ensure scalability, performance, and maintainability.
Qualifications
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related quantitative field.
Right to work in Australia (visa sponsorship may be considered but typically not feasible within project timelines).
Experience & Expertise

Essential:

Strong experience with Microsoft Fabric and Azure-native tooling (Data Factory, Synapse) using Spark or similar distributed computing systems.
Proven ability to design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines in production.
Strong Python proficiency focused on data workflows.
Deep SQL knowledge with experience in data warehousing, transformation, and optimisation.
Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT automation, metadata frameworks, and data quality controls.
Familiarity with data lakes, lakehouses, and modern data architectures.
Experience deploying solutions on cloud platforms using DevOps practices and IaC tools.
Confident working with data scientists and stakeholders to deliver production-ready systems.
Desirable:

Practical experience with Databricks (Delta Lake, Unity Catalog, Workflows).
Understanding of NoSQL databases and unstructured data.
Exposure to applied ML and generative AI (LLMs, agents) in an engineering context.
Experience visualising data with Power BI or Tableau.
Skills & Approach
Excellent communicator across technical and non-technical audiences.
Analytical, resourceful, and self-driven, with a strong bias for action.
Comfortable balancing multiple priorities across fast-paced projects.
Committed to documentation, collaboration, and delivery excellence.
Benefits

Join a team that offers the scale and stability of a global organisation with the agility and innovation of a tech startup.
For contractors and permanent employees:

Hybrid work policy with flexible remote options.
Competitive salary or day rate.
Latest tools and cloud infrastructure (Databricks, AWS, Azure).
Dedicated learning support for emerging technologies and data tooling.
Inclusive, collaborative culture with regular team sessions and innovation sprints.
Additional benefits for permanent employees:

Performance-based bonus scheme.
Competitive superannuation and annual leave entitlements.
Professional development budget for certifications, training, and conferences.

Job Title: Senior Combat Systems Engineer – Capability Development
Ad Text:
About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the role:

As we continue to grow our naval combat systems capability, we’re seeking an experienced Capability Development & Sustainment Engineer to shape the future of Australia’s AEGIS Combat System.
This role is central to defining long-term development pathways, sustainment strategies, and upgrade planning across the RAN’s AEGIS-equipped fleet.

You’ll combine your systems engineering expertise with strategic thinking to influence capability decisions, guide through-life support activities, and help deliver a 5–10-year roadmap that keeps the AEGIS Combat System effective, modern, and mission-ready.

In this customer-facing, collaborative role, you will:

Lead capability evolution, upgrades, and sustainment planning for the AEGIS Combat System.

Develop long-term capability roadmaps using evidence-based, risk-informed assessments.

Partner with the Destroyer Enterprise and Defence stakeholders to align plans with operational priorities.

Facilitate capability workshops, reviews, and customer discussions on future system direction.

Support system architecture updates, obsolescence management and engineering change proposals (ECPs).

Provide systems engineering guidance across the lifecycle to ensure cohesive, future-proof outcomes.

 

About you:

You’re a seasoned Systems Engineer or Capability Planner with strong Defence domain experience. You enjoy forward planning, influencing technical direction, and working with stakeholders to drive capability outcomes.

You bring:

Extensive experience across systems engineering, capability planning or sustainment.

Proven ability to develop or contribute to long-term capability or technical strategies.

Knowledge of system architecture, lifecycle management, obsolescence, and change control.

Strong communication skills and confidence engaging with Defence stakeholders.

Experience in Defence acquisition or sustainment—ideal for former ADF or enterprise-level planners.

Engineering degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronics, Aerospace, or similar.

NV1 security clearance and ability to access Export Controlled information.


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Category:
Teaching - Tertiary (Education & Training)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
The Role

Are you a dynamic, motivated and innovative person looking for a career opportunity in emerging technology governance? If so, join us in shaping the future of Army capability through a newly established position within the Army’s Robotics and Autonomous Systems Implementation Coordination Office (RICO).

As the EL 1 Artificial Intelligence Governance Lead, you will drive the implementation of responsible AI governance in the land domain. You will develop Army’s AI governance capability and provide guidance enabling land programs and units to develop AI use cases with clear pathways for introduction into capability.

Your responsibilities include:

Implement the Land Domain AI Governance Framework across Army programs and capabilities.
Enable Army to develop AI use cases aligned with Land force missions and our legal and policy obligations.
Coordinate risk assessments, compliance reviews, and assurance activities for AI-enabled systems in the land domain.
Provide advice to Army’s senior leadership on managing accountabilities, enabling infrastructure systems, and applying controls to AI-enabled systems.
Build Army’s AI governance capability within the Defence AI ecosystem.
Support the development of sovereign AI governance capacity across industry and academia.

About our Team

The Defence Autonomy Centre - Land (DAC-L) is a team within RICO responsible for coordinating and governing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the land domain.

The DAC-L assures AI-enabled capabilities on behalf of the Land Domain Capability Manager, supports land projects with AI adoption, and ensures the responsible use of AI in the land domain. 

This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of Artificial Intelligence (AI) adoption and governance in the land domain. 

Army is implementing the Land Domain AI Governance Framework to guide the design, development, testing and certification, delivery, deployment, and use of AI-enabled land capabilities across their lifecycle.

This ensures AI-enabled systems are resilient, scalable, and deliver practical solutions that enhance Army’s future readiness and ensure alignment with Government policy and legal obligations.

Our Ideal Candidate

You are an emerging technology leader who bridges legal and policy, procedural, and technical enabling areas to fill the EL1 Artificial Intelligence Governance role. 

You will bring:

Knowledge of emerging technology governance, risk, and compliance, ideally with experience in highly regulated sectors or national security.
Understanding of contemporary autonomous systems and AI systems of control.
Strong, pragmatic, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with cross-functional stakeholder management, including legal, policy, military operational, and technical practitioners.
Strong technical leadership and people management skills.
Advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related discipline.

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 28 January 2026

For further information please review the job information pack, reference ARMY/09412/25 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=BEE62B4A-7FCD-2D52-A7DF-E4778D4F1879

Location: Ulan, Blue Mountains & Central West NSW
Salary: Competitive salary package and lifestyle benefits
Ad Text:
Advancing careers. Advancing everyday life.

Glencore is committed to providing an environment that adheres to the Respect at Work Legislation.

As a PLC/Automation Engineer at Ulan Underground Mine, you will operate as a part of the engineering team reporting into the Engineering Manager. Ulan Underground is an established, efficient and high production underground longwall coal mining operation in the western coalfields of NSW. With state-of-the-art mining equipment and the latest technologies, we are leading exporters in thermal coal.

To succeed in this role, the ideal candidate has the following skills and experiences:

An electrical trade qualification and/or tertiary Engineering qualification,

In-depth knowledge of SCADA systems and Rockwell Automation software

Knowledge and experience in IT networking and system administration would be desirable.

Lead, maintain and develop the automation equipment and communication systems across the operation

Strong focus on system reliability, supervising personnel and continuous improvement aligned to delivering Mine site outputs.

About Ulan Coal Complex

Ulan Coal Mines has attracted people from all over Australia (and the world) who are drawn to the idea of launching or developing a mining career with the added benefit of comfortable residential-based work arrangement and family friendly lifestyle. The Ulan Complex is comprised of Ulan Underground Mine, Ulan West Mine, and Ulan Surface Operations. The Complex has two established, efficient, and high production underground longwall coal mining operation in the western coalfields of NSW. We are an established, efficient, and high production underground longwall coal mining operation in the western coalfields of NSW. With state-of-the-art mining equipment, the latest technologies, and best in class safety practices, we are leading exporters in thermal coal.

Make the move to Mudgee and benefit from:

Regional Allowance

Relocation Assistance

Novated Leasing & Salary Packaging

Gym Subsidies and Pool Season Passes

Education Assistance

Formal and informal career development

State of the art Sporting Complex

Brand new Hospital and Health Care Facilities

Lively community, with markets, music and festivals

Award-winning wine region

3.5 hours to Newcastle and Sydney

For more information about Ulan, click here.

For information about Mudgee, click here.

Applications Close:

For further information please contact: Marli Hungerford, HR Officer on (02) 6372 5175

Glencore provides unrivalled career and development prospects, great communities and the opportunity to work with leaders in your field.

Join an AI powerhouse that is going through a rapid expansion. Help customers implement agentic Ai workers. This is a permanent, full-time position. This is a hybrid working style in the CBD (no set days, people come in approx 1 day per week). You will architect how they can take their platform (microservices) and automate services, containerise them and then deploy into customers platforms. You will join the current team of 3 Solution Architects.

Position Overview
We are hiring an experienced Solution Architect to engage with customers and help them design the build of an agentic AI product/ platform. You will collaborate with client and partner technical teams, alongside the internal members to enhance tech solutions. This role requires you to efficiently navigate between detailed documentation and broader business strategies. You must be highly organised, adept in cross- functional teams, and passionate about advancing AI technology.

Responsibilities:

Support post-sales activities, working with existing and prospective customers on solutions we provide.
Leverage expertise in cloud platforms and architecture patterns to create scalable, secure, and high-performance solutions.
Oversee and deliver across the full SDLC and IT project management methodologies, ensuring that solutions are delivered according to best practices, timelines, and quality standards.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Design end to end solutions that meet client requirements, and ensure solutions are scalable and secure for enterprise application, integrations and large complex environments.
Provide technical leadership and guidance to development and implementation teams.
Keep abreast of emerging technologies and work with the product teams and how they can be leveraged in the product roadmap.
Requirements:

4+ years’ experience as a Senior Solution Architect or Enterprise level Architect who can do solution architecture design and documentation.
Key to your success is having a strong background is application design and/or background in consulting is highly desirable.
Strong experience across Azure and AWS, (GCP is a nice to have but not essential)
DevOps platform experience including CI/CD and modern pipeline
Extensive experience across Kubernetes, Helm and Docker
Extensive Bash scripting experience
Extensive Git experience
Proven experience running end to end SDLC’s
A background in Software Engineering
Preferably you have knowledge of AI/ML concepts however this is not a must have, as long as your motivated and curious to learn.

The Organisation: A retail organisation based in Sydney is looking for hands-on data leader (50-50) to own and execute on a multi-year data roadmap through the delivery of high-impact analytics and data solutions. Reporting into the CIO, you will play an important role in enabling data-driven decision-making across the organisation. This is the ideal role for someone who can think about the bigger picture and contribute with hands-on technical delivery. You will be based in Sydney and able to work in the office a minimum of 3 days per week. 

Key Priorities of the Role:

Build strong stakeholder relationships and be a trusted delivery partner by translating data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision making.  
Partner with C-Suite & ELT across Marketing, Finance, Retail & Operations to understand their requirements and translate into actionable data solutions. 
Hands-on delivery of these data solutions, ensuring adherence to best practices whilst leading a hybrid team consisting of one internal senior data engineer and an external delivery partner.
Ideally you have a data engineering background with expertise in Snowflake along with data modeling & ETL (dbt) & orchestration (airflow), Python, SQL, Power BI.
CI/CD & Jira or similar.
Apply & develop your knowledge of emerging technologies and AI tools such as Claude, Snowflake Cortex, NLPs, LLMs & automation.
Collaborate with data engineering, architecture & reporting colleagues to design, develop and implement these solutions whilst providing mentorship & guidance towards continuous improvement and knowledge sharing.
Your Skillset:

Demonstrated experience in leading a small data team whilst remaining hands-on in design & development of data solutions (50-50).
Strong data engineering background with progression into leading a team.
Hands-on experience in Snowflake DWH, SQL (SSAS), Airflow, DBT, Python, CI/CD, Power BI.
AI tools such as Claude, Snowflake Cortex & ML & NLPs.
Data lake architecture, strong multi-dimensional data modeling, real-time data streaming & EDD.
Enjoy business partnering with key stakeholders and C-Suite - become a trusted advisor to multiple business & operational teams.
Passion for continuous improvement & open to new tools & technologies.
Collaborative and mentoring leadership style.
Retail or FMCG experience highly regarded.
You must have Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency to be considered for this role and be Sydney based. Please apply below for immediate consideration.

Job Title: Principal Solution Architect - Artificial Intelligence Solutions
Ad Text:
Join a future-focused, innovative team driving digital transformation. NEC is a global leader in technology and communications solutions. As part of our growth, we’re looking for a passionate and experienced Principal Solution Architect – Artificial Intelligence (AI) Solutions to lead the strategic development and execution of AI products and solutions in the Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) markets.




This role is pivotal in supporting the company’s vision and ensuring that our use of AI and offerings meet the evolving needs of our business across various use cases and applications. The successful candidate will work closely with internal teams, clients, and vendors to architect and enhance AI solutions, driving innovation and compliance with industry standards.




Key Accountabilities

 

Vision and Strategy Development: Support the company's vision by developing strategic plans for internal adoption of AI and our product landscape, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.

Business Engagement: Engage within NEC (ANZ & global) and clients, defining roadmaps for the adoption and implementation of AI services. Apply a customer-centric approach to all aspects of work.

Product Architecture: Architect and collaborate on the application and integration of AI to enhance our digital and managed service offerings.

AI Ethics and Responsible Use: Exercise an awareness of potential biases in AI systems and the ability to apply governance frameworks and privacy standards to ensure fair and responsible use.

Vendor Collaboration: Work closely with our vendors to promote and drive AI solutions across the ANZ region, and internally.

Architecture Leadership: Provide architecture leadership to internal teams, guiding the development of consistent, high-quality AI architectures that meet business outcomes and comply with industry standards and security requirements. Function as Technical Lead during the development process while providing solution design and accurate cost inputs for proposals and business cases.

Advisory Role: Serve as a trusted advisor to Heads of and C-level executives, leading strategic, transitional, and target state architectures to drive the success of the company's AI adoption and evolution of modern services.

 

What You’ll Bring

 We’re looking for someone with a strong technical background and leadership experience:

Significant experience in AI solutions, product architecture, and integration strategies.

Strong understanding of the ANZ market, including regulatory and compliance requirements.

Demonstrated ability to work with clients, vendors, and teams to deliver innovative solutions.

Leadership skills with experience in guiding teams and influencing C-level executives.

Knowledge of industry best practices, standards, and security requirements related to AI.

Excellent communication, strategic planning, and project management skills.

Strong commercial acumen

Degree or relevant qualification in IT

Certifications in AWS, Microsoft Azure preferred

 

Why NEC?

Be part of a global, purpose-driven company at the forefront of innovation.

Lead impactful projects that drive Artificial Intelligence and our product landscape.

Work in a collaborative, inclusive, and forward-thinking environment.

Opportunities for career growth, mentoring, and skill development.




Please apply now.

About QIC

As one of Australias leading institutional investment managers with more than $100 billion in assets under management, we have a presence across four continents, seven offices and assets across global markets.

At QIC, we believe in shared value - where delivering strong investment returns can go hand in hand with doing good for our clients, people and communities. If we invest well, we will all do better together.

Life at QIC

We know that our people perform at their best when they feel a sense of belonging and are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work every day.  We provide a supportive work environment where everyone can thrive and feel valued for their meaningful contribution in delivering for the prosperity of our clients, people and communities.

Joining QIC, you can contribute to our employee led networks that champion our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, which consists of five key pillars: Gender Equality, LGBTQ+, Accessibility, Cultural & Linguistic Diversity, and First Nations People.

Other reasons to join us:
Flexibility and hybrid options encouraged – certified Family Inclusive Workplace
Recharge leave - additional 3 days leave per year
Annual Fitness/home office reimbursement
Ability to swap public holidays for those of personal, cultural or religious significance
26 weeks gender-neutral paid parental leave
Financial study assistance and study leave
Community leave for supporting the causes you love
Development opportunities to extend, expand and enhance your growth.
At QIC, we welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, the LGBTQI+ community, people with disabilities and people from all cultural backgrounds. We have an equitable, barrier-free application process so please inform us of your accessibility requirements in your application or you can reach out to our Talent Team on 07 3360 3800.

About the role 

 

Contract: 12 Months  

 

Join a high-performing team with solid tenure and a wealth of experience in delivering cutting-edge digital workplace solutions. Reporting to the Digital Workplace Lead, you’ll play a pivotal role in engaging with business units and stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver intuitive, best-practice solutions using Microsoft 365 and client-focused products. This is your opportunity to drive meaningful work forward in a supportive environment that values open communication, collaboration, and flexibility — with 2 days in the office and 3 days from home.  

 

Key responsibilities: 

 

Lead best-practice guidance across Microsoft 365: Dynamics 365 (CRM), Power Platform, Teams, SharePoint.  
Engage stakeholders, gather requirements, and deliver advisory services with mock-ups and proof-of-concepts.  
Analyse processes, identify automation opportunities, and leverage AI tools like Microsoft Copilot.  
Design, implement, and test new features; produce high-level documentation.  
Contribute to governance frameworks and maintain roadmap alignment with Microsoft 365 capabilities.  
Manage risks and ensure secure, reliable services.  
Support and optimise the Digital Workplace ecosystem through continuous improvement. 

 

About you 

 

IT qualifications or equivalent certifications and experience.  
Strong experience with Microsoft 365 technologies: Dynamics 365, SharePoint, Teams, Power Platform (Power Apps, Automate), Power BI, Copilot Studio, Dataverse, AI Builder.  
Skilled in advising, designing, and implementing practical solutions with automation focus.  
Ability to configure and build custom Dynamic 365 solutions (plug-ins, JavaScript) and explore AI innovations.  
Knowledge of Azure ecosystem, DevOps pipelines, Agile delivery, and governance.  
Advanced skills in end-to-end solution delivery and stakeholder engagement.  
Collaborative, client-focused, adaptable, and detail-oriented.
